oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of a sculptor working on a bust, three Vanderbilt students, and a photographic department manager at his desk. Nashville Tennessean, 1929 May 5.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mims, Puryear; Mims, Edwin; Milam, Gartrell; Coffee, Shelby; Gilbert, Mack; Hinton, Harold B.
Nashville Tennessean
Art; Sculpture; Students; Universities & colleges; Fraternal organizations; Group portraits; Journalists
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of a sculptor working on a bust of his father (a Vanderbilt English department head, pictured modeling), three Vanderbilt students with unusual haircuts from a recent induction to a club, and a (former Tennesssean editor) New York Times photographic department manager at his desk in Paris. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Burnell, C. J.; World Wide Photo
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
